website_summaries.verdict: Fitbit's first real smartwatch gets a lot of things right, including comfort, features and price, but it's not a slam-dunk design for everyone.
pros: works with iPhones and Android phones
cons: pop-out design for band-swapping and charging feels clunky
baked-in Fitstar workouts don't do much

customer_reviews.title: Too many issues
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my wife and have regretted it ever since. It constantly stops communicating with her phone (Galaxy S7) and each time I have to delete Fitbat app and go through the setup again. Even when it is connected notifications from the phone do not work consistently.
customer_reviews.author: tick509

customer_reviews.title: Love what it does, which there was a prettier version :)
customer_reviews.text: I love my Fitbits. I have a Fitbit for probably 10 years. I got the Blaze recently because I want to see my heart rate during exercise to make sure I was in the right cardio zone. I got a pink watchband for it to fem it up. My complain is it's big and bulky. I wish it was pretty! But it does what I want it to do. And it's improved the sleep detection, and I'm enjoying that. I wear it every day and wash my hands many times every day. I have to take it off to dry the band sometimes, but it's holding up fine.
customer_reviews.author: MominSchool

customer_reviews.title: Stops working as soon as warranty expires
customer_reviews.text: Blaze is a waste of your money. 2 months after the warranty expired, it stops working. Fitbit’s solution is to offer me a 30% discount on a new device! Wtf? You want me to buy another POS? I used my Blaze once a day for spin class. It was in the charger the rest of the time. Suddenly stops operating when out of the cradle. No option for repair per Fitbit. Check out the online community forums and you’ll see this happens to many others. Complete waste of $225.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip

customer_reviews.title: I'm SO over Fitbit!
customer_reviews.text: I got my first Fitbit (Charge) in January of 2016. I had several replacements after the band failed after a few months, then purchased the Blaze in February of 2017. I have had nothing but problems with inaccurate statistics, the unit not syncing for days, another failed band, and now the device just completely died for no apparent reason. For something that should be an enjoyable companion to my fitness/activities/sleep it has proven to be nothing but a constant source of frustration. Fitbit makes a crappy product and they know it. I will not be buying another one.
customer_reviews.author: E Evans

customer_reviews.title: Battery died in 14 months no repair option.
customer_reviews.text: Update on below negative review. Received email from customer service and they gave me several acceptable options to replace my tracker. Prior review.. I have had 4 fitbit trackers. The first was recalled for skin problems. I then bought the surge when it came out but before the year was part way over the band began separating from the watch and fitbit replaced it under warranty. Second surge started tearing so bought a blaze since the bands could be replaced. The battery just died less than 14 months and fitbit has no repair option. They offered a 25% discount on another purchase. A lot of money spent for a product that just makes it past the warranty then died.
customer_reviews.author: KEITH ANDERSON

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality and cheaply made.
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Blaze to replace my previous fitbit, which stopped syncing with my phone after about 6 months. After syncing the new device with my phone, I wasn't recieving notifications. I reinstalled the software, re-paired the device and troubleshot it for 1 hour+ with no luck. It wouldn't even receive test notifications sent from the app. After a lot of Goolgling, it seems like this is a common problem. Based on my experience, fitbit makes poor quality shoddy products. There are a lot of other smart watch fitness trackers on the market and I would recommend getting a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Cahill

customer_reviews.title: Blows the Apple Watch out of the water!💦
customer_reviews.text: The only cons: not waterproof, must get use to removing watch before swimming or showering. Calorie burning is much over estimated. Other then that it's a great watch, the battery life beats the Apple Watch by days. Lasts me 4-5 days on a full charge (with text notifications turned off). As accurate as a watch can count steps/strides while exercising. Great user face and app. Make sure to take it off when around water and to wear it a little loose like it describes in the directions and you'll love this watch!
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Watch is defective.
customer_reviews.text: Watch is defective. It gives a constant clock error and it does not records the heart rate (even though the green lights work). I have read very troubleshoot and followed every recommendation I could find on the fitbit page. I've reset it, restarted it, reinstalled it, and synchronized many times and changed every setting...it does not work.
customer_reviews.author: Edgar N.

customer_reviews.title: Very dissatisfied with Fitbit .......
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my husband for fathers day and at first I thought it was great until he told me the screen cracked just by putting it in the band , I called fitbit and they said that wasn't covered . Luckily I bought the extended warranty . They covered the cracked screen , fixed it and sent it back just for the screen to break again . It's going back to be fixed again but this is crap . I think its poor design and Fitbit should replace it with something else . Very unhappy with Fitbit ....
customer_reviews.author: Edwina Conner

customer_reviews.title: WAIST of money!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I loved the blaze. I even purchased a second one after my first one died after 17 months. This last tracker I bought on Oct 29, 2108 so it LITERALLY ONLY LASTED 8 1/2 months!!! Spending almost $200. is ridiculous!!! Not sure what product I'm going to purchase now. Don't waist your money like I did. Not worth it!!!
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: SAVE YOUR MONEY AND GET AN APPLE WATCH INSTEAD!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for my son in December 2017. It worked fine for a few months and then it would turn off unexpectedly. It went from working on a full charge for 3-4 days to not even lasting 12 hours. It is extremely frustrating considering the cost. I sat it on the charger for an entire day and once again it has turned off. I plan to purchase an apple watch instead. I suggest you do the same.
customer_reviews.author: Mocha Mom

customer_reviews.title: Does not work with Samsung Galaxy S8
customer_reviews.text: Fitbit states this watch is compatible with my Samsung Galaxy S8 phone. Unable to receive notifications on the watch. Went through all troubleshooting tips with no success. Talked to tech support and they stated it is a known issue with this phone/device combo and are working on fixing it in a timely manner. The phone has been out for more than 6 months and from what I read online these issues have been going on since the beginning. I was excited to try Fitbit as I have heard great things but will not go back due to a lack of diligence and misinforming the customers with no resolution
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love the watch!'
customer_reviews.text: I love the Blaze. It fits my personal needs perfectly. It continues to work well even when I am super sweaty or if I get it a little wet. You can't wear it in the pool or shower because you cannot submerge it, but that doesn't bother me. I am a little disappointed that the Blaze seems to be phased out from the FitBit line making it harder to find the screen protectors and watch bands for it. If you purchase the Blaze watch from Amazon, also purchase extra screen protectors and watch bands in case they start to disappear.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Curran

customer_reviews.title: Don't purchase any fitbit products unless you like to waste your money
customer_reviews.text: This watch is a piece of crap. At first it seemed great but at almost the 8 month mark the battery started dying the time. I tried to get support from Fitbit but they gave minimal support. Now a year and half later it just turns off or dies. Again tried to reach out to fitbit and they only thing they could do is give a minimal discount on a new one. You have to be kidding me. I had other fitbit trackers before and they only lasted a minimal amount of time as well. It's just not worth your money.
customer_reviews.author: Carmen

customer_reviews.title: I like it, but has had hiccups
customer_reviews.text: I have used this for 6+ months consistently; with a Nexus 6P and now a Galaxy Note 8. I have had intermittent issues with pairing, syncing, and tracking workouts. I also have found that the buttons\interface are poorly designed for ending workouts, it is actually fairly easy to inadvertently end a workout without even touching the buttons (I think this occurs as part of normal wrist movements while cycling and weight lifting). The band failed on me after about 5 months of use, though Fitbit replaced it free of charge.
customer_reviews.author: Nate

customer_reviews.title: Great e-watch... minus the battery.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this In April of 2018 for my wife's birthday. IIRC, it was easy to setup thru her iPhone 6... she loved wearing, tracking her steps, etc. Recently, the battery started acting up and decreasing charge. Finally, this afternoon it lasted maybe 3hours before it died. I've seen some videos on YT on how to change out the battery so I'll. E giving that a try as the worse that can happen is that I short it all out and completely kill it. Overall, I think it was a good purchase and, for how long the battery lasted, worthwhile. One star deducted due to the battery.
customer_reviews.author: Bruno B

customer_reviews.title: Will stop working with in 1-2 months of warrnty expiration
customer_reviews.text: I read several negative reviews about the Blaze not working a few months after warranty expires. I loved my prior FitBit and took a chance that this problem had been resolved. If you are okay spending $150.00 on a product that will only last a little over year then go for it. They will offer you a discount to purchase a newer FitBit, but I have lost faith in this company, why would I want to invests my money in a product with a little over a year life span.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent at what it does, and with a few more features it could be a game changer.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good fitness watch, but I wish I could answer phone calls, or provide limited responses to text messages, such as choosing between a few options like yes, no, or on my way. Being able to see who is calling or read a text message without having to dig out my phone is a really useful function. The vibrating alarm is very effective and a better way to wake up than an audio alarm. The sleep monitor was surprisingly informative and the ability to view my steps and minutes of exercise compared on a weekly basis is also a nice motivation to get more exercise.
customer_reviews.author: Melas Chasm

customer_reviews.title: Best Fitbit yet!
customer_reviews.text: I previously had the Fitbit Charge HR and just purchased the Blaze! I could not be happier with the product, the battery life and the touch screen especially made me happy!
customer_reviews.author: Jayden Fackelman

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product. It fits and works great
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product. It fits and works great. I only have suggestions are to include a tutorial on the watch so the it is more simple and allow for replying to messages from the watch. I know the replying to messages is a technological advancement that (hopefully) is being worked on, but it was just a thought. The silent alarm didn't wake me up the first night, but the second it actually woke me up. I love all the data it collects on my exercise, sleep, water intake, diet, and a ton of other data throughout the day. It's a great watch, I love it and i've only had it for a few days.
customer_reviews.author: Cooper Crews

customer_reviews.title: This is the best fitness/smart watch I have owned
customer_reviews.text: This is the best fitness/smart watch I have owned. It accurately keeps track of all my steps and sleeping patterns. It shows heart rate and was extremely easy to set up and use. I do recommend if you know that you can be abusive on the watch get a screen protector and the wrist band that is more heavy duty. The screen is fragile and can crack of break if you hit on something too hard. I have tried other fitbits and other smart watches this fitbit by far is the best option for someone looking for a fitness tracker and smart watch. The options are easy to use and I never have a connection problem.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: totally disappointed in this watch and Amazon
customer_reviews.text: The screen just flashes when I turn it on so is defective. An acquaintance has one too and same thing is happening to theirs. I should have the option to return and either be refunded or provided another watch . It has only been in use for one month! And yet the Amazon seller says no returns after Jan. 31. Do they know they become defective after a month?! totally disappointed in this watch and Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: Kelly S.

customer_reviews.title: Great smartwatch
customer_reviews.text: My fitbit arrived earlier than expected. It looks sleek, and was easy to setup get started. The visibility of texts is a nice add on. There doesn't seem to be a lag between receiving the text on my phone and it displaying on my fitbit. I'm pretty excited for the upcoming reminder to move feature, as I have a desk job and frequently forget to take breaks and move around.
customer_reviews.author: K.H.A.

customer_reviews.title: Would not purchase again!
customer_reviews.text: This is an update to my review on my Fitbit B!aze. For the first nine months it was great battery would last 2 or 3 days. Watch and phone stayed connected messages would show on watch, sleep hours showed everyday. Now it's like pulling teeth to get it to do anything. In phone I have Manuel connect then run find watch on fitbit app 4 to 10 times to get the information. Not happy with watch ,purchased this due to some health issues that need monitoring! Do not believe I would buy another fitbit.
customer_reviews.author: catvsurfer

customer_reviews.title: Battery does not stay charged therefore displays wrong date/time
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to receive the Fitbit Blaze because I heard some really good things about it but it seems that I obviously got a lemon!!! I had it about a mouth. It needs charging every 2 -3 days and when I don't it displays the wrong date/time and perhaps heart rate and steps too. The attached picture was taken today, Tuesday, 9/10 at 8:35am and not as displayed! I am so disappointed to have spent that much money on this product and it only lasted a month!!! It would be great if it could be replaced or at least tell me how to fix it! Should probably start with a new battery!1
customer_reviews.author: andrea grooms

customer_reviews.title: I'm done with Fitbit
customer_reviews.text: I've owned the Charge, Charge HR and this Blaze. I'm not rough on them in the least, never get them wet, still, they have all failed. The Charge and it's replacements had band issues. The bands would swell and come apart. The Charge HR and its replacements had issues with the screen cracking. Now, the Blaze. The buttons stopped working, then it suddenly went into a non-stop vibration mode. I've wasted a lot of money on these trackers. Fitbit has never stood behind the product, so I'm giving up.
customer_reviews.author: Robbey

customer_reviews.title: I have had this fitbit for about 5 1/2 months ...
customer_reviews.text: I have had this fitbit for about 5 1/2 months now and I can't get this to work right. The bpm is always over 100 when I am just sitting and when I am active it reads less. I can't get it to stay synced with my phone so I can keep track of my steps. Twice now after I have charged it it will be 4-5 days behind on the date. I have googled and youtubed on how to fix this and it seems to work for a few days and then it stops again. We are in a contest at work and unfortunately I am losing. Any suggestions?
customer_reviews.author: Sonya W.

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Junk, I've had the Blaze for about 2 years now. I have been through 3 different phones in that same time period and have consistently had syncing issues with the Blaze. It's to the point where I don't even use the app anymore because I get tired of having to remove and re-add the watch every time I want to sync. I had a charge HR before this...no problems, my wife has a charge 2...no problems. Not even remotely worth the money with the headache it causes. The only positive thing I can say is that it has physically held up and I am generally hard on watches.
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: i think the fitbit blaze is great! love it so much more than my apple ...
customer_reviews.text: i think the fitbit blaze is great! love it so much more than my apple watch, as i didn't use any of the apps for it. hopefully they start integrating some kind of apps though, like My Fitness Pal or something for reminders to log food! FitBit UI has always been my favorite UI out of all of the other fitness trackers. Love that it can be used across devices (android/iOS) instead of "galaxy gear" or an "apple watch" which are only compatible with their own OS.
customer_reviews.author: Olivia Hartz

customer_reviews.title: Fitbit Blaze disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I don't like that it doesn't have stand alone GPS tracking capabilities you do have to use your watch with fitbit program running which uses your phones battery up a lot quicker. Also, the pace isn't correct almost all the time. the watch has no capability to have the screen on all the time if you want, so you have to keep waving your arm to see info while running and even sometimes that doesn't work and you have to push button. overall I am not happy and wish I had bought another fitbit surge
customer_reviews.author: Carl Jones

customer_reviews.title: Not that great.
customer_reviews.text: I did not like that the watch gave me a rash within just a couple of days. The Garmin's watch doesn't even do that. Plus there are not enough display designs, most display designs is for the versa. Battery life shorter if you enable the display to turn on automatically when you lift your wrist. I got it for the heart rate tracker. It's got other nice features but the downfall is the rash problem, honestly just going get a different watch, this watch is ultimately not worth buying.
customer_reviews.author: Robert A. Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: Half the time it can't locate my phone for sync when I ride my bike. Sometimes it just stops tracking and I lose the physical workout data. I'm not convinced it is actually tracking correctly. Very frustrating to use this watch. The only thing it does seems to do accurately is record heart rate.
customer_reviews.author: James E.

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality product.
customer_reviews.text: The Fitbit Blaze I purchased would not hold a charge for more than 4 hours. I had to recharge it several times per day to keep it running. Previously, I had owned several Fitbit Charge and Fitbit Charge HR models, All of them had broke in less than one year. They either quit working or fell apart. I wanted to upgrade to a better model and thought the Blaze would provide longer life than what I had experienced with the Charge and Charge HR. After this bad experience, I now believe ALL Fitbit products are low quality and would not recommend any of their products to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Karen S. Graham

customer_reviews.title: Allergy to Band :(
customer_reviews.text: The Fitbit Blaze keeps me on my toes! I enjoy the many features. However, the reason for the 3 stars instead of 5, customer service. I wear the watch most of the time, except while showering or near any moisture. Just recently, I had developed a small skin allergy (itching) at the corner of my wrist from the band. I contacted Fitbit, was given a case # and was told a Rep. will call me back....I STILL WAITING! My first call, I told them I love the product; however, do they have a hypoallergenic band (cloth?), especially during sleep-time. STILL WATING! I'd like to use my watch.
customer_reviews.author: Inalah@2219

customer_reviews.title: I've become a slave to the Fitbit
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't exactly sure if this product was for me prior to purchase. My initial purchase was going to be the Charge II but when the Blaze went on sale on Cyber Monday, I took a chance. Very glad I did. Good new is I'm totally addicted to this thing. I've becomes a slave to the steps, the calories, the water, the heart rate, and that's a good thing. Have lost four pounds in thirty days primarily by just meeting my step goal daily. The only negative I have is I can't sleep with it on, have tried but with no success, so I'm not using the sleep tracking feature. Otherwise I have no complaints. Five stars from me.
customer_reviews.author: D. Vaughan

customer_reviews.title: I like it, but I do not like that you ...
customer_reviews.text: I like it, but I do not like that you can only get the Fitstar Ab workout on your watch. The rest of the workouts have to be viewed from the computer which defeats the whole purpose. It counts stairs accurately most of the time, and the steps seem to be accurate as well. Not very aesthetically pleasing, but I guess its not meant to be a fashion statement.
customer_reviews.author: Loulou

customer_reviews.title: It's great seeing my stats at The end of the day
customer_reviews.text: Wearing this watch motivates me to keepinactive. Instead of taking a taxi home I would opt to walk to rack up steps. It definately makes me feel to be active. It's great seeing my stats at The end of the day. I feel it will help me reach my fitness goals. It's a great smart watch too! If you want you can get notifications from different apps. I set it to get notifications from Facebook messenger, whatsapp,and viber which are essentials for me. You can also get just regular texts and calls notifications too. Don't have to search for my phone to read my messages. Battery life is great. 4 days for me.
customer_reviews.author: Nazia

customer_reviews.title: CAUTION...WARNING  BAD PRODUCT.
customer_reviews.text: CAUTION...DO NOT BUY. This is a bad product. I had one malfunction & they replaced in October. Now thr replacement is malfunctioning as well. Skipping floors & inaquaretly tracking sleep. It’s maddening. They won’t replace as they go on date of original purchase date. I do not know about other FITBIT’s as I only have experience with the Blaze. They have no repair facilities, nor do they have ANY support centers in the USA. Now they are not supporting the BLAZE nor are they manufacturing it. Again WARNING DO NOT PURCHASE.
customer_reviews.author: RCnSamantha

customer_reviews.title: Only lasted 3 months!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband for Christmas to replace his original Fitbit. 3 months later, the screen just flashes like lightning. He can still track his exercise in his laptop, but the watch face is worthless- the whole reason I chose to purchase this product! Since I ordered it at the end of November, the window for returning it has closed. I am very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: kindergartenteacher

customer_reviews.title: I had the charge HR and was very happy with it
customer_reviews.text: I had the charge HR and was very happy with it, but it eventually was worn out. So I upgraded to the Blaze, and absolutely love it! I also love the idea that you can change the band, and the charger is much better than the charger for the Charge HR. I love that it tracks your sleep, and stairs and all the same stuff as the charge HR PLUS it also sends your texts and calendar reminders through the Blaze. and the color screen is pretty sweet too. I would highly recommend this fitness watch!
customer_reviews.author: Rhiannan Oxos

customer_reviews.title: One of the best presents I have ever gotten
customer_reviews.text: One of the best presents I have ever gotten. I love this thing. It never leaves my wrist (unless showering). I have lost 8 lbs in 4 weeks just walking and keeping track with this device. It's like a personal cheerleader that is always with you.
customer_reviews.author: James C

customer_reviews.title: I totally love it!
customer_reviews.text: I totally love my Fitbit Blaze. I have an Alta that I've been wearing for months (I love it, too). But I decided I wanted all the extra features that the Blaze offers. I especially love the touch screen, the heart rate monitor, and all the colorful clock faces to choose from, not to mention how it can detect the type of exercise you're doing and how many flights of stairs you've climbed. I highly recommend the Blaze and wish I hadn't waited so long to get one.
customer_reviews.author: shops2much

customer_reviews.title: Addictive
customer_reviews.text: It had truly helped me to not use my phone as much since I'm now also using my watch hahaha. It is such a simple idea to just have something tell you how well or how poorly you are being active. I enjoy having the choices to change bands and bezels. It has held up to my rough life style of fixing items and has not been scratched or cracked yet. I do own a more rugged band during work and have purchased the screen protectors also.
customer_reviews.author: Facilities Manager

customer_reviews.title: It's definitely a motivator
customer_reviews.text: My wife bought herself the standard fit bit blaze and liked it so much she figured I had to have one. We are both working out every day now because of this gadget. It promotes competition and makes you want to get moving. This was an easy five stars. I work various shift times and sleep is always a problem. The bit tells me just how well I slept and if I need more. The text and phone call vibration feature is nice for those of us that keep our phone on silent and the food tracking is helpful as well. I wish my Pyle scale linked to the app as well but I'm still very happy with this device.
customer_reviews.author: TheAmazonSavage

customer_reviews.title: Very good fitness tracker
customer_reviews.text: I have had two Fitbit ONE clip-on trackers before I purchased this Blaze. I have had this one about 2 years now and it's still going strong. I have worn it while working out, working on home construction projects, hiking, and kayaking. I do not wear it in salt water or if I am swimming, but getting it wet on the kayak trips has not bothered it at all. There are times when the text notification from my phone does not come through, but after 2 years of pretty hard use, that is not a big deal to me.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Stutts

customer_reviews.title: Careful with updates
customer_reviews.text: I have owned this watch for 2 1/2 years. It has worked perfectly without issue. I've used it so much that band started to tear. I replaced it and went on using it every day. Then I ran an update... 3 days later the heart monitor stopped functioning. Coincidence? Possible... In my opinion, something I spend $200 on needs to last for many years not 2 1/2 years. I do not like buying and throwing out electronics.
customer_reviews.author: Rick B

customer_reviews.title: Poor battery performance a month after purchase
customer_reviews.text: After a little over one month of use, the watch doesn't hold a charge for more than 2 days. Having used the fitbit Charge HR for over a year, I didn't expect battery performance on the Blaze to degrade so quickly. Apparently, the visual bells and whistles come at a cost. Unfortunately, the return window (30 days) for the product closed last week. For info, the Heart rate monitor has been set to auto and is therefore not constantly draining the battery.
customer_reviews.author: BH

customer_reviews.title: Go Go Gadget Fitness Watch
customer_reviews.text: Surprisingly accurate on the steps for me.. which makes me happy. Ran it against my Polar f4 HRM and was spot on. No more crappy chest strap! Love the way it looks and feels. Surprisingly comfy for being so big. Don't regret the money, love the alarm features. Love getting texts and call notification on the watch, caught a couple calls I need to catch that I would have missed otherwise. Love the look and I feel Little like Penny from Inspector Gadget with it and my smartphone together lol
customer_reviews.author: Crystal T.

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Had nothing but problems with the watch. Texts do not come through as they should - get maybe 1 of every 3 texts. Also, sends repeated texts. I get one text on my phone, but it shows up 3 or 4 times on the watch which drains the battery. I also reiceved a phone call that I sent to vm on my phone, however the watch shows the phone is still ringing when it is not. Visually it is so cute and I really liked it - but the way it works is dissapointing. Requesting a refund today and sending it back.
customer_reviews.author: Kris

customer_reviews.title: This watch is pretty accurate with my calculated BMR and TDEE
customer_reviews.text: Got this watch to help me with loosing weight. Mainly wanted to know exactly how many calories a day I was burning. This watch is pretty accurate with my calculated BMR and TDEE. And my workouts are also way more accurate than guesstimating from a calculator online. The watch is water resistant, I accidentally forgot it was on when I went in a hot tub (oops).. it was fully submerged for less than 5 seconds and it survived!!
customer_reviews.author: D. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: thinking I could get the fitness tracking I liked on my old Fitbit HR plus all the other ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought a Moto 360 smartwatch earlier this year, thinking I could get the fitness tracking I liked on my old Fitbit HR plus all the other smartwatch features. However, the Motorola smartwatch was disappointing on every level. I've had the Fitbit Blaze for a day now and so far I like it. It doesn't notify me of any calls, text or email like a smartwatch. I don't know why, but I also don't really care. This seemed to be a common complaint from reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Really, really great!
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my husband for his birthday. He was really pleased with it. It has been really used and has held us well. There was a little bit of charging problems, but they worked themselves out and he is extremely pleased with all the features. He uses it continually and it has held up without any problems. It is VERY large so if you have a small wrist you would want to get a smaller Fitbit!
customer_reviews.author: Mike4920

customer_reviews.title: POS, not worth nearly the money, costs like an Apple Watch, weighs and feels very cheap compared to that !
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointing!! I liked the fact that I didn't have to charge it every night like the stupid Apple Watch requires, but compared to the Apple wathces, this is a piece of junk ! ! ! It feels cheap, the frame abound it is cheap, the idea that you have to take the watch out of the frame seems exceptionally stupid. It was a PIA to get it to sync, I had to call for support to accomplish something that should be simple. After the 2nd or 3rd recharge, the damn thing had the wrong time on it, and I could find no way to reset the time!
customer_reviews.author: Elder Statesman Doctor

customer_reviews.title: Another year, another Fitbit not Working again!
customer_reviews.text: I love the Fitbit Blaze until it stops working. I can’t give it 5 stars because next month will make a year and it stopped working properly sometime in July. It’s been touch and go and a lot of online research to maintain power for more than four or five hours. This is my second Fitbit Blaze and I’ve tried my best to keep it clean after each use to sustain battery life. Maybe I’m sweating too much.
customer_reviews.author: Karrie

customer_reviews.title: Does not sync Heart rate with Apple Health, even with 3rd party syncing apps
customer_reviews.text: Not happy with this purchase. I bought this because my cardiologist wants me to track my heart rate continuously. I didn't realize the Fitbit line does NOT sync heart rate with Apple Health, nor can I see that there are any plans or effort to enable this critical function. Had I known this, I would have chosen a different product.The only way to sync with Apple Health is to purchase a third party app, which can only sync selected data elements. If you use Apple devices, this is not the product for you. It's probably fine if you are willing to settle for the Fitbit app and don't want to keep all your health records in a single place.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie Pace

customer_reviews.title: which looks even more like a watch
customer_reviews.text: It does everything you expect from a Fitbit. For the price, however, Fitbit will have to start thinking about waterproofing. The competition is really starting to give Fitbit a run for the money. Compared to the Garmin 230 and the Withing, which looks even more like a watch, this product leaves somewhat to be desired. However, Fitbit has a better online community for challenges with friends and family. If you don't care about that though, then check out some of the other options.
customer_reviews.author: Mitchell Mosher

customer_reviews.title: Nothing But Problems !
customer_reviews.text: Nothing but problems with this. 1) Bought in May 2016 and it died in August 2017. 2)High heart rate (180-190) sent me to Dr. & need for heart monitor. Nothing wrong. When I wore this on one wrist and my husband's Garmin on the other, this showed 193 and the Garmin 112. 2)Mega problems syncing. Spins and spins and gives error messages 4) When i go a few days without syncing, the time would get wacky. I mean totally wacky. Off by many hours and minutes. I love the features and ease of seeing my activity, but not worth the hassle. Save your money.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth and Rich

customer_reviews.title: I liked the fit bit
customer_reviews.text: I liked the fit bit. Was obsessed. With the watch enjoyed. in June 2017 got caught in a rain shower. Since than the HR Monitor has not worked. and the battery life was cut down to less then 8hrs. so after 15 months the only thing working was the step counter. Why the Battery lasted. Support walked me through trying a couple of things with no luck. Then fitbit support said there was nothing else they could do. So I would not recommend the fitbit Blaze. To only last for 15 months for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J Winans

customer_reviews.title: Not very accurate with step count.
customer_reviews.text: I have been a Fitbit user since the beginning, and after much consideration I thought it was time to upgrade from the One. Unfortunately I find that the Blaze is not as accurate as the One when it comes to step count. I wore both for a few days and was getting a significant less step count in the Blaze, however if I stood in place and swung my arms it counted false steps. I really liked the other features of the device, but I want something that will provide an accurate count, I will be returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Atalanta

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This is a very detailed product, it has small led display that shows all of the important information. Like floors climbed, heart rate, steps, calories burned and a few others. It also has built in workouts and can monitor certain exercises. A few notable features include an alarm that is set from the fitbit app, also containing a stopwatch and countdown as well. This watch is has a great fit and is of sturdy construction. I have beat and banged this watch on walls and my car door a few times and has only sustained small unnoticeable scratches. I really love this watch and would highly recommend it to anyone that is looking for a quality fitness watch.
customer_reviews.author: Montrell Durham

customer_reviews.title: it has the largest screen but the smallest writing on the watch faces
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the Blaze because it had the largest screen so I figured that it would be easiest to read but it isn't. The choice of watch faces is VERY limited and the only ones that have day, date and time are too small. I immediately returned it and will order a Versa which has scores of choices readable faces. Unfortunately the Black Friday Sale is over and all the prices have gone back up. Amazon wouldn't give me the Black Friday price on the Versa.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the price.
customer_reviews.text: Battery life is not predictable. Sometimes goes days on a full charge, sometimes only a day on a full charge. Tracking steps seems fairly accurate but minutes are way off. It always shows many more active minutes that what I know to be the case. Heart rate is rarely functional and, when it does work it’s not usually accurate so I wear a Polar chest strap monitor instead. Other features are ok. Tells time accurately. Alarms work well. I had an entry level Fitbit before this one that worked better for tracking minutes and a lot cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: NOT COMPATIBLE W GALAXY S8 PLUS!
customer_reviews.text: Is NOT compatible with Samsung galaxy s8 plus. Can not receive notifications. Called Fitbit support and they told me sorry my phone is too new and they don't know when they will update their system to be compatible with the S8 Plus. This is unacceptable to me for the simple fact that I have a new phone so these functions should work, not to mention the fact that they State you can receive notifications. Nowhere on the product purchase information does it tell you which phones are compatible in which are not. I spent $150 on this and I am very disappointed than I cannot receive text messages or see who is calling
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: One downside
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love the Surge along with the band style/size and the color. I did upgrade and this seems to suit my wants/needs better than my previous Fitbit. The previous two bands had separated/pulled away at the screen. I submitted my first under the warranty...then the replacement gave me issues as well. This band isnt connected in the same way. I feel it was due to my wrist being in between the small and large only size options. ONE downside to this band is that I'm getting color transfer from my clothing and/or keyboard so it's starting to look dingy. I will be purchasing some off market bands to replace it!
customer_reviews.author: JustWindowShopping :)

customer_reviews.title: Hates S8+
customer_reviews.text: I've loved my fitbit products. I ordered the Blaze to upgrade from the Charge2 that I've had the last year.... sadly the Blaze DOESN'T play nice with the Samsung S8+. Per Fitbit it does, but your not able to get notifications from your phone to the watch. Fitbit is aware and "the engineers are working on it" they told me. But with further investigation it appears that it's been a problem with the S8 since the phone came out. I returned my watch since that was one of the features I loved. Hope they figure it out soon.
customer_reviews.author: AT

customer_reviews.title: WOW! super impressed
customer_reviews.text: this is SLICK!!! so comfortable to wear and sync's with phone quickly and frequently. LOVE the display and big numbers for my old eyes! So what it doesn't have GPS, what do you need a map of your run for anyway? IF you do need a map, it syncs with phone GPS easily enough. Love the little exercises and great sleep tracking. The website is very user friendly and easy to navigate. Had a garmin 235 and it would always lose connection with phone and wouldn't sync. Could this be any better!?!!? NO!!!
customer_reviews.author: Raquelle

customer_reviews.title: Not exactly the best gift for the technologically challenged
customer_reviews.text: I thought this was the way to go until I discovered that you have to pop open the retaining frame to remove the face and charge it. Not exactly the best gift for the technologically challenged, plus the removal and re-insertion take the fun out of things. Charging is good, but you have to work. If it was possible to access/charge from the underside, then I might have been on to a winner...
customer_reviews.author: S. Collins

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: I must say that this watch is pretty slick. Not a lot of extras but everything you need in a fitness tracker. I own a gym and am recommending our clients purchase fit bit products. The only reason I gave it 4 stars instead of five is the extra step involved in getting to some of the info. for example, depending on the screen, you will have to tap a couple of times to see your heart rate, when you are not exercising. Overall, great product and worth buying. I would recommend this to anyone interested in keeping track of daily stats and real time exercise stats.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Meyer

customer_reviews.title: Not reliable / Doesn’t last long / Zero flexibility on warranty
customer_reviews.text: Bought this 14 months ago. Took good care of it but crapped out on me. Fitbit support said the item was “defective” and that I should expect it to last longer but refused to repair or replace. They have Zero flexibility on the 365 day warranty but wanted me to buy ANOTHER product at 25% off. Waste of money for how long it lasted when you can get similar (throw away) product for $50-$70
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: GOOD MID-PRICED GOOD WATCH LASTED LESS THAN TWO YEARS. Nice features with poor battery.
customer_reviews.text: Good smart/fitness watch with nice features BUT as time went by battery needed to be charged much more frequently (capacity substantially decreased). In less than two years, battery charge lasted less than 24 hours and therefore could not track/use sleep tracking features. FitBit advised watch could NOT be fixed. They offered 25% discount on A new watch but only if purchased on their website at full MSP. So bottom line is good watch but expect to replace after 1 year when warranty ends. Hope this helps.
customer_reviews.author: Howard B

customer_reviews.title: In love
customer_reviews.text: Can I just say I am in love with my new fitbit!! I used to have the charge HR but I've been wanting to change for apple watch for a while. When I saw Blaze, I decided to give it a try because I trust the accuracy of Fitbit for fitness. Since that is my goal, I opted for this Blaze. It might not be a smart watch like the Apple one but boy is the best Fitness watch I've ever had. It even reads the stages of your sleep now!!!! If your main goal is fitness this is the watch for you!
customer_reviews.author: Ana Beatriz Santa Maria

customer_reviews.title: Freezes a lot
customer_reviews.text: Great app, tracks steps, calories, sleep, everything. You can even get texts and alerts to the watch which I loved. The problem is it's not at all accurate. I will be watching the step count as I walk and it's not moving at all. I called Fitbit but hey just have me reset it over and over but it still freezes. I am not the only one I know who has this problem. I am several thousand steps below what I should be on my Fitbit app, when I compare it to my iPhone steps. I wish I had spent the money on a better watch
customer_reviews.author: Julie Paul

customer_reviews.title: Battery lasted just over 4 months
customer_reviews.text: When I first received my Blaze (April 28, 2018) it worked awesome, I had no problems with it at all. On Sept 18, 2018 it would not charge. I tried all the troubleshooting fixes but none worked. I contacted Fitbit's online chat customer service and we went through all the troubleshooting fixes again and it still wouldn't work. They are replacing the device at no charge, however I am very concerned that this is a know issue to the manufacturer and the new one will have the same issue. Will let you know how it works out.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen A. Hill

customer_reviews.title: What can I say about this wonderful product!
customer_reviews.text: What can I say about this wonderful product!!!!! I just love it!!!! It has made me health conscious. I am determine to reach my goals. One of them is the 10,000 steps a day. I see myself trying to make more than that. The water intake and the tracking of my sleep. I am not sleeping as much as I use to and I noticed that since I use the FitBit, I am sleeping more than my coworkers do. Because one of my coworker bought one and was using it for a couple of weeks, and she was loving the results, I decided to purchase one too. We are just loving it.
customer_reviews.author: Brunnie

customer_reviews.title: At first I loved using this
customer_reviews.text: At first I loved using this, it was cool and easy to wear and had awesome features, but ultimately I returned it because I noticed the HR monitor was completely off whenever I was doing physical activity. At home or just on a slow (I do mean slow) walk it seemed accurate (I eventually compared it by taking my own HR and by using two other HR monitors) but for fast walking or jogging or running it was substantially underestimating my heart rate. After I finished my morning run for example, it said my HR was in the 120s when it was actually in the 180s.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua David

customer_reviews.title: The only negative is after I tell it to track ...
customer_reviews.text: The only negative is after I tell it to track an exercise it doesn't respond to any notifications. The notifications are very weak when they are working. I would not feel them when exercising anyway. That was the real reason I bought it. One very positive thing it does is monitor my sleep in a manor that shows I have sleep Apnia. It shows that I am being woken up many many times each night but I don't realize it. The doctor says this is why I feel so tired. Hello CPAP?
customer_reviews.author: Bob Massey

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: This is an upgrade for me and I love it! I didn't find it difficult at all to learn how to charge it, set it up and use it. If you actually READ the instructions you will not have any issues. I think some of the reviews are a little misleading in that regard. The wrist band is comfortable for me, I don't notice it. What I liked most is that it transferred my old data so it's like I didn't miss a beat. I also like that it is is a truly customized device for you.
customer_reviews.author: Jenn

customer_reviews.title: I was a little disappointed, but ...
customer_reviews.text: Professionally (like quality items should be). I was a little disappointed that I needed to go online to find user instructions (it is NOT included). Just go to fitbit.com and select your fitbit model and look for users manual. The instructions are pretty straight forward. The "Blaze" wears great and the functions are pretty amazing. I would buy from this seller again and I do recommend the FITBIT Blaze.
customer_reviews.author: Danny Black

customer_reviews.title: Best smart watch (until someone untethers the phone from one)
customer_reviews.text: A gift for my son, he absolutely loves it. It's nice looking, functional as a watch, and notifies him who is calling or texting so he doesn't have to look at his phone. Having a sedentary job, he also likes that it reminds him to move, even if it is just to stand and stretch. The Fitbit app keeps all his stats and is easy to use. He said he also finds himself taking flights of stairs to see his heart rate increase. If it gets him to move more, I say mission accomplished.
customer_reviews.author: CasualComfort

customer_reviews.title: Don't Waste Your Money
customer_reviews.text: Expensive rubbish! Battery life claims are total fabrication. A fully charged batter lasts 2.5 days whether I'm wearing this thing or not. It give beautiful graphs detailing every night's sleep, showing REM, Light, Deep and wake cycles. It even gives the detailed analysis when I'm not wearing it at night and its in another part of the house. Absolutely rubbish. Its "data" are fantasy and fabrication and this purchase was an utter waste of good money. It's an expensive and dumb watch, which by the way, will sometimes give you time a couple of hours off the correct time.
customer_reviews.author: bwanagary

customer_reviews.title: almost literally and loved it. So I bought this to test out ...
customer_reviews.text: I have the fitbit one and put that thing through the ringer, almost literally and loved it. So I bought this to test out the sleep function. I love it even better than the one. I am not a watch person and I sure did not like the wrist band...so I ordered a replacement...but I DO love the tracking features of this thing. It also lets you see who is texting and calling you or FB messaging you among other things. Amazing little piece of technology.
customer_reviews.author: RLG

customer_reviews.title: Still 5 Stars & Over 2 Years
customer_reviews.text: This watch is in the top tier of gifts I've ever given my wife. She loves the look and feel. She has 3 bands and picks the one that matches the outfit d'jour. She has NEVER expressed any complaint about it which is the ultimate accolade coming from one of the ladies at the table of women at which the waiter asks "Good evening ladies, is anything alright?"
customer_reviews.author: Bob Vollmer

customer_reviews.title: Great watch, but gets dirty easily
customer_reviews.text: This watch has changed my life. I can take exercising so much more seriously now that this thing tracks my sleep, eating, workouts, EVERYTHING and keeps me accountable at all times. I really do love this watch but the band gets dirty really easily and to replace it Fitbit wants to charge 29.99. You gotta be out of your mind smh. Found some cheaper bands here on Amazon that I might get, but I have only had this band and watch for 2 months and it is filthy.
customer_reviews.author: Lele

customer_reviews.title: Good fitness and smartwatch. Good price.
customer_reviews.text: I got this after my pebble died. I replaced the band it came with with Oitom Metal Bands Strap and got Supershieldz for Fitbit Blaze Tempered Glass Screen Protector to protect the screen. The Oitom magnetic strap is a lot more comfortable than the plastic strap that came with the watch. I was worried when I got the small strap by mistake but it fits my wrist fine with an inch or so to spare.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy if you have the Galaxy S8/S8+
customer_reviews.text: Great Tracker...if it works with your device. Worked flawlessly with my S7 Edge back in June when I got this. Now with my S8 I get no notifications, have to manually sync it because all day sync does not automatically work and also drains the battery badly and to top it off the manual sync rarely works though seems to be best when at home with fast WiFi, out and about forget about it. Icing on the cake? FitBit says its now a supported device. What a joke.
customer_reviews.author: Justin C.

customer_reviews.title: Dead after only 15 months
customer_reviews.text: Completely stopped working after about 15 months. It got standard usage as an everyday watch. Now the screen won't even turn on despite being fully charged. Talked with customer support and they walked through several different things to try, none of which worked. They said it was outside of the warranty period (12 months) so they offered 25% off a purchase of a new watch. Are you kidding me? For the price I paid for this watch I expect it to last much longer than 15 months, and certainly not just going to buy another one after the first one I bought died. That's the last Fitbit I'll ever buy.
customer_reviews.author: Charlottean

customer_reviews.title: Step Counter Is Inaccurate
customer_reviews.text: Went through THREE FitBit Blaze Smartwatches. None of them accurately counted steps. Even got in touch with the FitBit company to try to reconfigure the 2nd one, with no luck. Apparently this is a flaw with this watch. If you rely on a step counter, do yourself a favor and spend the extra $50 on another brand that works (Huawei, for example).
customer_reviews.author: J. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Fitbit Blaze stopped working suddenly
customer_reviews.text: Loved the Fitbit Blaze. Wore it constantly, especially to workouts 5 to 7 days a week. My hubby got one too. BUT the heart monitor suddenly stopped. Had it for 1 year and a half. So customer service said no longer under warranty and offered me a 25 percent discount on another. My question is, why do I want to spend money on something that will break and the company does not back up? Something wrong here. If your product is good, you should stand by it. At least offer to repair it...
customer_reviews.author: Sue B.

customer_reviews.title: I like it, does exactly what it is supposed to ...
customer_reviews.text: I like it, does exactly what it is supposed to as far as track my fitness. Love the iphone app it syncs with, and LOVE the feature it has that alerts me of phone features, texts, calls, alarms. The thing I really dislike, and mentioned by hundreds of others...the unpredictability of the "watch" to actually function when I turn my wrist. It works maybe 3 out of 5 times. Not positive but I think the longer its asleep, that is when it doesn't like to "wake up". For that reason alone, it only gets a 3 and I render the price tag way out of its league
customer_reviews.author: A.H.

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool For Monitoring Overall Wellness
customer_reviews.text: My wife loves this thing. She tells me all the time about her time spent in all sleep stages, how many steps she walks, her heart rate while doing different tasks, and a lot more. She never takes it off. So if you like tracking that stuff, this is an awesome product to have. The app that pairs with it provides some great information as well.
customer_reviews.author: Ty

customer_reviews.title: Notifications too small to read
customer_reviews.text: Watch works fine but the font for the only watch face with a date on it is sooo small I can't read it :( Notifications, especially text messages are also in really small font, despite the large screen size. Hey fitbit, your engineers may be in their twenties but lots of users are over 40 - can you help us out please? Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Margo Glew

customer_reviews.title: Not happy anymore
customer_reviews.text: Update... Lowered rating because I it can't seem to keep time or sync up very well after a few months. It counts steps incorrectly now. Sometimes not counting at all. As a watch, it has to sync to keep from getting hours off within weeks. No good. It takes days of trying to sync sometimes. If it can't tell time or keep steps, it's worthless.
customer_reviews.author: Jody Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Stopped tracking heart rate
customer_reviews.text: I do not abuse my electronics. Tonight while I was exercising my heart rate monitor quit working. This happens occasionally because of sweat, but normally it comes back. Tonight it didn’t. I haven’t even had this watch 2 years. A $200 watch should last longer than 2 years. This is all just a money grab. Planned obsolescence at its best.
customer_reviews.author: Klinger

customer_reviews.title: Black screen, wont work off of charger
customer_reviews.text: Got this as a gift, made sure I got it well before Christmas. Was the most expensive gift and you would think it would work...wrong. Placed it in the charger and synced with phone. Once it said it was fully charged, took it off the charger then everything went black. Tried restarting and nothing. Long story short it only works on the charger... what a crap gift that was. I have experience with customer support for fit bit for another fitibit issue and the experience was good, so will go that route again with this one but still something that cost this much sure as heck better work out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: Stozer

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT PRODUCT!!
customer_reviews.text: I really LOVE this Fitbit Blaze! All the features are excellent, and the set-up could not have been any easier. Once you download the app to your phone and answer a couple easy questions, the app syncs to the blaze pretty much in real-time. Lots of bells and whistles too. I can even see my text messages on the Blaze, and it has great reminders to get you up and moving. Just an excellent product! I've been using it a couple months now, and I just love it!
customer_reviews.author: Karie Vigeant

customer_reviews.title: Major issue with recharging the battery
customer_reviews.text: It shows fully charged and within a couple hours it just dies. So very disappointed in the Blaze. I really like the features but the aggravation is just not worth it for me.
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: Battery life is absolutely terrible
customer_reviews.text: I've been holding off on the review just to check things out 1st, well, my review is the battery life is absolutely terrible. The watch itself, not the best but not bad. I have to charge this every 3 days, completely dead.....
customer_reviews.author: BMac

customer_reviews.title: Terrible
customer_reviews.text: My wife just got this for christmas and it Won't keep a charge and now the return has expired. What a joke. Now, it wont sync. We've tried rebooting each item and still nothing.
customer_reviews.author: Darrin

customer_reviews.title: Connects to GPS and has onscreen workouts!
customer_reviews.text: My husband absolutely LOVES his Fitbit Blaze. I only wish I had one too! I bought this for his birthday and had no idea it had so many features. Besides all of the health features, he can also get all of the notifications from his phone such as texts, emails, and anything else he wishes to receive. He keeps track of different workout summaries, his activity throughout the day, his different sleep stages and one of his favorite features is being able to control his mobile music playlist.
customer_reviews.author: Denise R.

customer_reviews.title: When it syncs, it's great
customer_reviews.text: I've had this Fitbit now for at least 6 months. I really like it, but the one thing that drives me crazy is that it's hit or miss when you go to sync it to your phone. It will sync fine, then for some reason it won't sync no matter what you do. I usually have to delete the watch and add it new to trick the phone into thinking it's new...and this usually works. As with most technology, I think Bluetooth needs to be replaced with something more reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Terry

product_meta.title: Fitbit Blaze Special Edition, Gun Metal, Large (6.7 - 8.1 inch) (US Version)
product_meta.description:
Color:Black/Gunmetal| Size:Large (6.7 - 8.1 Inch)Get fit in style with Fitbit Blaze—a smart fitness watch that helps you maximize every workout and every day. With advanced technology in a versatile design, this revolutionary device is built to track your workouts, monitor your performance stats, and gauge your progress. PurePulse continuous heart rate and multi-sport modes enhance every exercise, while next-generation features like Connected GPS and FitStar workouts on your wrist help you take your fitness to the next level. All-day activity and sleep tracking, smartphone notifications and Reminders to Move help you stay on top of your day. And interchangeable band and frames and customizable clock faces on the hi-res color touchscreen let you personalize your style for every occasion. With all this and more, Fitbit Blaze has everything you need to reach your goals, packed into one sleek timepiece.Using Bluetooth LE wireless technology, Fitbit Blaze sends smartphone notifications and syncs automatically to computers and 200+ mobile devices. Certain features like smartphone notifications or Connected GPS may require Android 5.0+. Syncing range: Up to 30 feet Syncing requires Bluetooth LE and Internet connection. Windows 10 computers that do not have Bluetooth LE will need a wireless sync dongle in order to sync. Syncs with Mac OS X 10.6 and up, iPhone 4S and later, iPad 3 gen. and later, Android 4.4 and later, and Windows 10 devices. Music control via Bluetooth Classic on Android, iOS and Windows devices.The Fitbit Blaze classic band is made of a flexible, durable elastomer material similar to that used in many sports watches, and includes a surgical-grade stainless steel buckle and frame. The gunmetal Blaze features a gunmetal stainless steel buckle and frame made with a premium PVD plating process. The pink/gold Blaze features a 22k gold-plated stainless steel buckle and frame also made with a premium PVD plating process.

MANUFACTURER CONTACT INFORMATION
Customers contact: support@fitbit.com
feature_bullets: See simplified heart rate zones for quickly checking exercise intensity during workouts with PurePulse(TM) continuous, wrist-based heart rate monitoring (no uncomfortable chest strap required)
Enable connected GPS to map your routes and see run stats like pace and duration on display (when your phone is nearby)

Track steps, distance, calories burned, floors climbed and active minutes. Stay connected with call, text & calendar alerts and notifications from your favorite apps like Gmail, Facebook and more (when phone is nearby).Start a FitStar workout on your wrist and get step-by-step instructions and graphics to ensure you complete each move correctly
Operating temperature: -4 degree to 140 degree fahrenheit, Maximum operating altitude: 28,000 feet
The minimum and maximum circumference range between 170 - 206 millimeters
Use multi-sport tracking to track runs, cardio, cross-training, biking and more. Effortlessly and automatically record other workouts to your dashboard with SmartTrack
